titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Al Qassim Family Collection of photographs AD.MC.031
titlestmt.author: Jasmine Soliman and Jonathan Burr, with assistance from Amna Al-Qubaisi for Akkasah: Center for Photography NYUAD

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-05-25 18:14:38 +0400.
profiledesc.langusage: Description is written in: English, Latin script.

did.unittitle: Al Qassim Family Collection
did.abstract: This collection of photos represents the personal photography of Mr. Abdulghafoor Alqasim from different areas of United Arab Emirates. The images date from both before and after the birth of UAE as a country in 1971 as well as Mr. Abdulghafoor's trips to other countries throughout the world. The collection reflects Mr. Abdulghafoor's interest in photography when he was a student in Dubai in the nineteen-sixties and extends decades into the era of digital photography. Akkasah has worked closely with Mr. Abdulghafoor to assure that his family's photographs are digitally preserved not only for the sake of posterity but also to serve as important cultural documents of the birth and rapid growth of the United Arab Emirates as a nation.
did.container: Digital surrogates only - physical objects not deposited

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Collection was digitized as it was recieved.

custodhist.head: Custodial History
custodhist.p: Akkasah, the Center for Photography at NYU Abu Dhabi, acquired the collection in February 2017.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection of photos represents the personal photography of Mr. Abdulghafoor Alqasim from different areas of United Arab Emirates. The images date from both before and after the birth of UAE as a country in 1971 as well as Mr. Abdulghafoor's trips to other countries throughout the world. The collection reflects Mr. Abdulghafoor's interest in photography when he was a student in Dubai in the nineteen-sixties and extends decades into the era of digital photography. Akkasah has worked closely with Mr. Abdulghafoor to assure that his family's photographs are digitally preserved not only for the sake of posterity but also to serve as important cultural documents of the birth and rapid growth of the United Arab Emirates as a nation.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Any rights (including copyright and related rights to publicity and privacy) held by Mr. Abdulghafoor Alqasim are maintained by New York University. Permission to publish or reproduce materials in this collection must be secured from repository. Please contact Akkasah at akkasah@nyu.edu

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Collection obtained directly from Mr. Abdulghafoor Alqasim.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date; The Al Qassim Collection; AD_MC_031; box number; folder number or item identifier; Akkasah Center for Photography, New York University.
